item_title: CALL TO ORDER, ROLL CALL & TRIBAL ACKNOWLEDGEMENT.

item_blurb: Public comments that are not related to any of the items specifically listed on the agenda will be heard at approximately 9:00 am, for no more than one hour. At the discretion of the Chair, speakers may be given up to 2 minutes. Due to the transition to a virtual meeting platform, the Coastal Commission at this time will not allow for the ceding of time from one speaker to another speaker. Note: You may address the Commission on a specific topic one time only each month. Please submit a request to speak by 5:00 pm the day before the hearing to assist with meeting management sign up. We will stop taking speaker requests by 8:30 am on each day of the meeting. Please see the Coastal Commission’s Virtual Hearing Procedures memo for submitting a request to speak.

item_title: DEPUTY DIRECTOR’S REPORT for ENERGY, OCEAN RESOURCES and FEDERAL CONSISTENCY.
item_blurb: Report by the Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, negative determinations, matters not requiring public hearings, and status report on offshore oil & gas exploration & development.  For specific information contact the Commission’s Energy, Ocean Resources, and Federal Consistency Division office at (415) 904-5240.

subitem_title: Application No. 9-23-0055 (Southern California Edison, Catalina Island)
subitem_blurb: Application of Southern California Edison to install facility upgrades, including a new seawater intake well, new water storage tank, and other related infrastructure at the Pebbly Beach Desalination Facility to allow for an increase in production capacity and water reliability, on Catalina Island, Los Angeles County (TL-SF).
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report.  For specific information contact the Commission’s San Francisco office at (415) 904-5260.

Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report.  For specific information contact the Commission’s Santa Cruz office at (831) 427-4863.

subitem_title: City of Carmel-by-the-Sea LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-CML-23-0021-1-Part A (Historic Context Statement Update).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing to determine whether the Commission concurs with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by the City of Carmel-by-the-Sea to update its Historic Context Statement for the years between 1966-1986 is minor and thus should be approved as submitted, and if the Commission objects to such determination, possible action to extend the deadline for final Commission action on the amendment. (MF-SC)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-3-MCO-23-0018 (Isabella 2 LLC, Monterey Co.)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Concerned Neighbors at Carmel Point of Monterey County decision granting permit with conditions to Isabella 2 LLC to construct a new 1,837-sq.ft., 2-story single-family home at 26308 Isabella Avenue, Carmel Point neighborhood of unincorporated Monterey County. (BA-SC)
subitem_status: NO SUBSTANTIAL ISSUE FOUND

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-3-STC-19-0208 (190 West Cliff Drive Mixed Use, Santa Cruz)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Jim Conway & Anita Webb, Save Santa Cruz Westside, Gillian Greensite, & Patricia Forrest of City of Santa Cruz decision granting permit with conditions to Cliff Bay Partners LLC to construct a new 4-story mixed-use project with 89 residential units (including 10 affordable units and a density bonus to allow a fourth story); private rooftop decks; ground-level commercial space and parking;  public plaza; two levels of underground parking requiring 60,600 cu.yds. of cut and 2,600 cu.yds. of fill; street, sidewalk, and intersection improvements; undergrounding of utilities; heritage tree removal with onsite replanting at a 3:1 ratio, and related development, on inland parcel at 190 West Cliff Drive in the City of Santa Cruz. (SC-SC)
subitem_status: NO SUBSTANTIAL ISSUE FOUND

subitem_title: Application No. CDP 3-22-0826 (South Bay Blvd. Bridge Replacement, Los Osos, San Luis Obispo County)
subitem_blurb: Application of San Luis Obispo County to replace 189-ft. long, 3-span bridge over Los Osos Creek with new 300-ft. long, 2-span bridge to meet seismic safety standards; public access improvements; habitat restoration, and related improvements in unincorporated town of Los Osos in San Luis Obispo County. (RM-SC)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Ventura office at (805) 585-1800.

subitem_title: City of Malibu LCP Amendment No. LCP-4-MAL-22-0043-1 (MMHS Campus Specific Plan). Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the time limit for action up to one year on City of Malibu’s request to amend the Land Use Plan (LUP) and Local Implementation Plan (LIP) of its certified LCP to incorporate the Malibu Middle and High School Campus Specific Plan into the Malibu LCP. (DG-V)
subitem_status: Approved

subitem_title: City of San Buenaventura LCP Amendment No. LCP-4-SBV-22-0029-1 (Streamlining Procedures). Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the time limit for action up to one year on the City of San Buenaventura’s request to amend the Implementation Plan portion of its certified LCP to add a new section to the City’s Zoning Regulations to implement streamlining measures for the permitting process within the coastal zone and to make other minor revisions. (WD-V)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-4-STB-22-0013 (G & K Farms, Santa Barbara Co.)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Sarah Trigueiro from decision of County of Santa Barbara granting permit with conditions to G & K Farms to construct 25,418 sq. ft., 25 ft. tall cannabis processing building and a detention basin, installation of two emergency generators and ten 3,450 gallon water tanks, and grading consisting of 1,400 cu. yds. of cut and 1,000 cu. yds. of fill at 3561 Foothill Rd. in the Carpinteria area, Santa Barbara County. (MK-V)
subitem_status: Postponed

subitem_title: Application No. 4-21-0778 (Malibu Bay Club, Ventura)
subitem_blurb: Application of Malibu Bay Club and California Department of Parks and Recreation to repair and improve existing seawall, including resurfacing, remove and replace seawall cap, 4 beach access stairways, and sidewalk along inner boundary seawall, repair storm drains and sinkholes, install guardrails along top of seawall and handrails in stairwells, at 41000 Pacific Coast Highway, County of Ventura. (SF-V)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 4-22-0408 (Sandyland Cove Homeowners Association)
subitem_blurb: Application of the Sandyland Cove Homeowners Association to replace an approximately 59-ft.-long, 17-ft.-wide wooden vehicular bridge on Sandyland Cove Road over Franklin Creek within the Carpinteria Salt Marsh, with an approximately 74-ft.-long, 22-ft.-wide, single-span concrete bridge, including abutments in a new location further outside the stream banks, replacement of a water line under the bridge, removal of piles, and a temporary pedestrian bridge (for use during construction only), in unincorporated Santa Barbara County. (WD-V)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-5-VEN-23-0015 (Assil, Quartz Hill, LLC, Venice, Los Angeles Co.)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Richard Stanger (Citizens Preserving Venice), Ernestine Elster, Julian Sy, Carol Muchin, Ger Jones, Lizzie Jones, Evelyn Tickle, David Turnbull, Mark Levy, Jonathan Sherin, Michael Gervais, Angela Crawford Gervais, and Barbara Bills from City of Los Angeles West Los Angeles Planning Commission decision granting permit with conditions to Robert Assil, Quartz Hill, LLC for the remodel and addition to a 4,056 sq.ft., 22-ft. 2 in. high, four-unit apartment building with a partial second story and two two-car garages resulting in a 5,962 sq.ft., 2-story, 28-ft. high, 4-unit apartment building with mezzanine level, rooftop deck and 4 two-car garages for total of 8 parking spaces, at 15 W. Westwind Street, Venice, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County. (BW-LB) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)
subitem_status: Postponed

item_blurb: At a convenient time during the meeting, the Commission (CCC) will have a closed session to discuss items of pending litigation, including:

item_title: CALL TO ORDER and ROLL CALL

item_blurb: Please Note:  There will be no Public Comment on Thursday due to an extremely full agenda.  If you wish to speak during the public comment period, please submit a request to speak during public comment on Wednesday

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0177 (Jeff Jordan, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Jeff Jordan to remove dock system components, to include  20 ft. x 8 ft. dock and 20 ft. x 3 ft. gangway with new system including a like for like dock,  24 ft. x 3 ft. gangway, and two 14-in. replacement guide piles. Modifications will reduce overwater coverage by 18 sq.ft. at 4010 Channel Place in Newport Beach, Orange County. (ETP-LB)
subitem_status: CONCURRED

subitem_title: Application No. 1-23-0356 (Caltrans, Eureka)
subitem_blurb: Application of the California Department of Transportation to conduct a geotechnical investigation that includes geophysical surveys and geotechnical drilling of up to 22 subsurface borings to a maximum depth of approximately 200 ft., up to 10 of which would be located within Eureka Slough, to inform project design and feasible alternatives for the Eureka Slough Bridges Replacement Project located along Highway 101 at Eureka Slough, approximately post mile 79.9, Eureka, Humboldt County. (AS-A)
subitem_status: APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0003 (Page, Seal Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of James Cliff Page to demolish 922 sq.ft. single-family home and 360 sq.ft., 2-car garage and construct 24 ft. 6-in high, 2,211 sq.ft. 2-story single-family home with  detached 370 sq.ft. 2-car garage and  513 sq.ft. ADU located over garage. No grading is proposed, located at 320 8th Street, Seal Beach, Orange County.  (FSY-LB)
subitem_status: APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 6-22-0917 (Bradberry, Solana Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Travis and Maribel Bradberry to replace all windows, doors, siding and roofing materials on 2,086 sq. ft. 2-story single-family home with attached 480 sq.ft. garage on 5,700 sq.ft. lot, at 141 Pacific Avenue, Solana Beach, San Diego County. (JP–SD)
subitem_status: APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Permit Amendment No. 1-10-032-A10 (Humboldt County Resource Conservation District, Ferndale)
subitem_blurb: Request by Humboldt County RCD to amend permit previously granted for the Salt River Ecosystem Restoration Project to (1) modify the two-mile-long setback berm and associated drainage ditch constructed in 2013 on Riverside Ranch during Phase 1 of construction of the project to improve drainage on adjacent agricultural lands during extreme Eel River flood events, and (2) authorize an additional five-year period of ongoing maintenance and adaptive management activities throughout the project area on farmlands along the Salt River, Ferndale area, Humboldt County. (MBK-A)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: City of San Diego LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-SAN-22-0064-3 (Community Planning Group Reform).
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by the City of San Diego to amend its certified Local Coastal Program Land Development Code (IP) to reflect the legal status of community planning groups as independent agencies is de minimis. (AL-SD)
subitem_status: Postponed

subitem_title: City of San Diego LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-SAN-23-0013-1 (2022 Land Development Code Update). Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 60-day time limit for Commission action for up to one year on the request by City of San Diego to amend its certified Local Coastal Program Land Development Code (IP) to implement the 2022 Land Development Code Update suite of changes. (AL-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Application No. 6-21-0566 (Ovard HOA, Oceanside)
subitem_blurb: Application of Ovard HOA to repair and augment 179-ft.-long section of rock revetment including restacking rock, import approx. 10% new rock, remove private access stairway and concrete grouting within the revetment rocks, at 1601 S. Pacific Street, Oceanside, San Diego County. (TR-SD) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as explained further in the staff report.)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 6-22-0152 (Carlsbad Slope Stabilization, Carlsbad)
subitem_blurb: Application of City of Carlsbad to demolish 600 linear ft. of retaining wall and construct 800 linear ft. of new retaining wall; grade and revegetate portions of failing slope; install new pedestrian improvements, at northeast side of Park Drive between Cove Drive and Bayshore Drive, Carlsbad, San Diego County. (KC-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: City of Huntington Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-HNB-21-0057-1 (Magnolia Tank Farm)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by City of Huntington Beach to amend LCP for vacant 29-acre site to change LUP land use designation from Public to Residential Medium Density (RM), Commercial Visitor (CV), Open Space-Park (OS-P), and Open Space-Conservation (OS-C), and creation of Specific Plan Overlay; and corresponding Implementation Plan changes from Public-Semi with Oil to specific plan to allow up to 250 residential units , a hotel with up to 175 market rate hotel rooms and no fewer than 40 lower cost overnight accommodations with ancillary retail and dining; Open Space - Parks and Open Space – Conservation; at 29 acre property bounded by Magnolia Street, the Ascon Property , the AES electrical generating station, and the Huntington Beach flood control channel and Magnolia Marsh, in Huntington Beach, Orange County. (MV-LB)
subitem_status: CONTINUED

subitem_title: City of Dana Point LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-DPT-21-0079-2 Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend time limit for Commission action up to one year for certification of City of Dana Point LCP Amendment to amend the Land Use Plan (LUP) and the Implementation Plan (IP) of the certified LCP to allow for two hotels and modify the allotted square footage for visitor-serving commercial uses in Planning Area 3 of the Dana Point Harbor Revitalization Plan, in Dana Point, Orange County. (SA-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Newport Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-NPB-23-0019-1 Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 90-day time limit for Commission action for up to one year on the City of Newport Beach request to amend the Implementation Plan and Land Use Plan of the certified Local Coastal Program, including revision of ADU regulations for consistency with state law and modification of development standards for Bay Island and 3014 Balboa Boulevard, in Newport Beach, Orange County. (CS-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended
